message:
Lebanese sources are reporting an Israeli UAV attack a short time ago on a vehicle in the Qasmia area, near the village of Barj Rahal in the Tyre governorate in southern Lebanon.
One injured. The vehicle was passing in the area between a UNIFIL post and a Lebanese army post.

message: Meanwhile, while Hezbollah is busy with propaganda videos, unofficial Lebanese channels report that Ibrahim Salameh, a Hezbollah operative, was killed in the Israeli strike earlier today in Aitaroun in southern Lebanon.
event_breakdown: Israeli strike kills Hezbollah operative Ibrahim Salameh in Aitaroun, southern Lebanon.

message:
Hezbollah has released a polished propaganda video lasting over four minutes, showcasing for the first time the underground facility "Imad 4," named after Imad Mughniyeh, the Hezbollah commander killed in Syria in 2008. 

The facility appears to be dug into rocky terrain and is spacious enough to accommodate truck movements. The video features missiles, rockets, and launch systems, accompanied by familiar incitement from Nasrallah with Hebrew subtitles.

Hezbollah aims to enhance its image in an effort to deter Israel from starting a war against it. Hezbollah was considerate enough to also release a slimmed-down version for easier viewing on mobile devices.
event_breakdown:
* Hezbollah has released a polished propaganda video showcasing its underground facility "Imad 4" in rocky terrain. The facility is spacious enough to accommodate truck movements. The video features missiles, rockets, and launch systems accompanied by Hebrew subtitles.
* Hezbollah aims to enhance its image to deter Israel from starting a war against it.

message: Gazan sources: Yesterday and today, in the center of the Gaza Strip, Hamas executed a number of collaborators with Israel.
event_breakdown:
Gaza: Execution of Collaborators with Israel

Hamas, the governing authority of the Gaza Strip, is reported to have executed a number of alleged collaborators with Israel over the past two days. The incident, which occurred in the center of the Gaza Strip, reflects the tense security situation in the Palestinian territory.

message:
Evacuation from east of Deir al-Balah:
Palestinian sources report that thousands of residents of eastern Deir al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip have evacuated to the west following the instructions of the IDF spokesman.

The municipality of Deir al-Balah published a statement that the evacuation announced today by the IDF spokesman will prevent access to 10 water wells and two water reservoirs in addition to the fact that it will endanger residents who will try to reach 3 more water wells. According to the municipality of Deir al-Balah, a serious water crisis is expected to arise in the center of the Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown:

According to the municipality of Deir al-Balah, a serious water crisis is expected to arise in the center of the Gaza Strip.

event_breakdown:
Security forces in Burkina Faso have reportedly shot and killed at least eight people in anti-coup demonstrations, but security sources said 10 or more civilians had died in the clashes. According to witnesses, shots were fired in two neighbourhoods: Kaya, a working-class area of the capital Ouagadougou, and P
«
Current location of Burkina Faso is {"longitude": 2.3697414, "latitude": 11.5907628}
Burkina Faso security forces have reportedly shot and killed at least eight people during anti-coup demonstrations. Witnesses said shots were fired in two neighborhoods: Kaya, a working-class district of the capital Ouagadougou, and Pissy, a suburb further north.

Government officials have not yet commented on the clashes, but the security source said the security forces acted in response to an attack on a police station on Sunday evening, by "small independent groups".

Burkina Faso has been wracked by political and security unrest since his military seized power in January and dissolved parliament, and a government delegation has been meeting with military representatives in recent days in an attempt to ease tensions. Government negotiator Isaac Zida said late on Sunday that progress was made during those talks, and a government spokesman said that discussions with all parties would continue on Monday, with the aim of reaching an agreement that could lead to elections.

message:
IDF spokesperson in Arabic recently issued new evacuation instructions for residents of the Gaza Strip:

1. Residents of the eastern neighborhoods of Deir al-Balah (central Gaza, an area where the IDF has not yet maneuvered) are requested to evacuate.

2. Residents of Qarara, Mawasi, Jalaa, Hamed, and al-Nasser in northern Khan Younis are requested to evacuate.

3. Due to the evacuation in Khan Younis, the humanitarian area is being reduced (the section highlighted in red on the map at the expense of the humanitarian area marked in yellow).

##
An interesting evacuation, in light of the ongoing talks today in Doha...

The current event in the security category that can be placed on map is:
IDF Spokesperson in Arabic recently issued new evacuation instructions for residents of the Gaza Strip.

message:
It's always nice to see that "celebs" also cooperate and take part in popular programs in the Israeli prison:
The Palestinian member of parliament on behalf of Hamas, Sheikh Mahmoud Khatib, from Bethlehem, was released from prison in Israel yesterday after 10 months.
Faiz Mesek from Hebron, who went straight to his barber, and the red-haired Abdullah Abu Shahidm, from the village of Abu Shahidm in the Ramallah governorate, were also released and honored with before and after pictures.

All stuck to the prison diet.
event_breakdown: release israeli prison, diet, hebron, ramallah

message:
Hamas official Hussam Badran on the negotiations in Doha:

“Hamas views the talks on prisoner release and a ceasefire from a strategic perspective, aiming to end the aggression against Gaza.

From Hamas's perspective, the current talks are part of a plan to implement what has already been agreed upon in the past.

Any agreement reached must include a comprehensive ceasefire, a full withdrawal from Gaza, the return of displaced persons to their homes, and the reconstruction of the strip, alongside a prisoner exchange deal.”

event_breakdown:
Hamas official Hussam Badran on the negotiations in Doha:
Hamas views the talks on prisoner release and a ceasefire from a strategic perspective, aiming to end the aggression against Gaza.
From Hamas's perspective, the current talks are part of a plan to implement what has already been agreed upon in the past.
Any agreement reached must include a comprehensive ceasefire, a full withdrawal from Gaza, the return of displaced persons to their homes, and the reconstruction of the strip, alongside a prisoner exchange deal.

message:
First public statement by a Hamas official since the end of the round of cease-fire talks in Qatar:

Senior Hamas official Muhammad Mardawi told "Arab TV" a short time ago that Hamas will not accept any solution that is not compatible with the proposal that was put forth on July 2nd.

Mardawi adds that the Palestinian people will not pay the price of the American position covering for Israel and its crimes.
event_breakdown: Hamas will not accept any solution that is not compatible with the proposal that was put forth on July 2nd.

message: Impressive footage of the attack on the towers in Khan Yunis's Hamad neighborhood, in the southern Gaza Strip, earlier today.
event_breakdown:
Impressive footage of the attack on the towers in Hamad neighborhood, in Khan Yunis's southern Gaza Strip, earlier today.
The video, believed to be filmed from nearby rooftops, shows a series of explosions in a strategic building that was consequently targeted by the Israeli army after the Hamas launched rockets into Israel earlier in the day
Huge fire billowed from the scene while huge plumes of smoke emitted over the sky after targets were hit for the second time on Tuesday by Israeli forces.
Todays attack on Gaza's Hamad tower comes after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned earlier of a large-scale operation in the area.
The building has been witnessed targeted because of Hamas rockets being fired into Israeli territory.
The Israeli army told 'Hamas you targeted our civilians but we will harm your civilians. IDF has a clear and simple message.
The conversation has not been edited for punctuation, spell or grammar.

message: The Qatari Al Jazeera network from a "senior source in Hamas": what we (the mediators - AA) informed us about the results of the talks in Doha does not coincide with what was agreed upon on July 2.
event_breakdown: Al Jazeera recently reported on a security event in Doha, Qatar that took place on July 2, 2022. According to Al Jazeera, a mediation effort between Hamas and another party did not align with what was agreed upon during the mediation talks in Doha on July 2, 2022.
